channel.title: CVE Feed for Moxa -- MXsecurity Series
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Moxa -- MXsecurity Series

item.title: CVE-2023-39982|2024-09-30T20:16:40.675Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in MXsecurity versions prior to v1.0.1. The vulnerability may put the confidentiality and integrity of SSH communications at risk on the affected device. This vulnerability is attributed to a hard-coded SSH host key, which might facilitate man-in-the-middle attacks and enable the decryption of SSH traffic.

item.title: CVE-2023-39979|2024-09-30T20:18:16.494Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: There is a vulnerability in MXsecurity versions prior to 1.0.1 that can be exploited to bypass authentication. A remote attacker might access the system if the web service authenticator has insufficient random values.

item.title: CVE-2023-39981|2024-09-30T20:17:40.304Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: A vulnerability that allows for unauthorized access has been discovered in MXsecurity versions prior to v1.0.1. This vulnerability arises from inadequate authentication measures, potentially leading to the disclosure of device information by a remote attacker.

item.title: CVE-2023-39983|2024-09-30T20:15:47.058Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: A vulnerability that poses a potential risk of polluting the MXsecurity sqlite database and the nsm-web UI has been identified in MXsecurity versions prior to v1.0.1. This vulnerability might allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to register or add devices via the nsm-web application.
